DOC.brief_title: Oocyte Cryopreservation : Slow Cooling Versus Vitrification Techniques Oocyte Survival
DOC.detailed_description: Cryopreservation oocytes desirable : 1 ) would allow infertility patient store excess oocyte instead embryos , eliminate ethical religious concern accompany embryo storage ; 2 ) permit storage donor oocytes avoid donor-recipient synchronization difficulty ; 3 ) help woman may face sterilization due chemotherapy radiation . Oocyte cryopreservation therefore gain popularity option infertility treatment well fertility preservation . Oocyte cryopreservation use conventional slow-cooling method much success ; however recent result provide optimism ( Boldt et al. , 2003 ; Porcu et al. , 1997 ; 2000 ; 2002 ; Yang et al. , 1998 ; 1999 ; 2002 ; Winslow et al. , 2001 ) . Vitrification also employ ( Hong et al. , 1999 ; Kuleshova et al. , 1999 ; Yoon et al. , 2000 , 2003 ; Chung et al 2000 ; Wu et al. , 2001 : Kuwayama et al. , 2005 ) increase oocyte survival rate live birth . Vitrification perform suspend oocyte solution contain high concentration cryoprotectants plunge directly liquid nitrogen ( Rall Fahy , 1985 ) . The advantage technique prevent formation ice crystal within oocyte . However toxic effect high concentration cryoprotectant medium concern . New vitrification technique attempt accelerate cooling rate decrease cryosolution volume concentration , may reduce potential toxicity . In addition , rapid cool rate result reduce chilling injury ( Vajta et al. , 1998 ) .
DOC.criteria: Patients ≤ 36 year old Day # 3 follicle stimulation hormone ( FSH ) < 10mIU/ml , Estradiol < 70 pg/ml . The study limit couple wish cryopreserve excess embryo , would otherwise excess oocyte discard . Body Mass Index ( BMI ) ≤ 35 Patients currently see office Male partner require microsurgical epididymal sperm aspiration testicular sperm extraction ( MESA/TESE ) sperm retrieval Day # 3 follicle stimulation hormone ( FSH ) > 10mIU/ml , estradiol > 70 pg/ml Diagnosis Polycystic Ovary Syndrome ( PCOS ) Body Mass Index ( BMI ) > 35
